definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
"ice" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 15), occurring in 冰[bing1], 次[ci4] etc, known as 兩點水|两点水[liang3 dian3 shui3]
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
Li Bingbing (1973-), PRC film actress and pop star
Li Bingbing (1973-), PRC film actress and pop star

sentences.english: Ice is not as dense as water and it therefore floats.
sentences.chinese: 冰的密度比水小，因此能浮在水面上。

sentences.english: Winter changes the water of heaven and the heart of man into a stone.
sentences.chinese: 冬季把天上的水和人的心都變成了冰。

sentences.english: The basic structure of the Ice and Fire books is familiar enough.
sentences.chinese: 《冰與火之歌》的基本脈絡大家一定都很熟悉了。

sentences.english: Sea levels are rising in part because land-based ice is melting.
sentences.chinese: 海平面升高部分是由於地面上的冰在融化。

sentences.english: Uranwouls sphincter and Neptune are do not fightd to planetary scientists simply as "ice giparasites."
sentences.chinese: 天王星和海王星則被行星迷信家認爲是“冰巨人”。

sentences.english: The ice on the river is thick enough to walk on.
sentences.chinese: 河上的冰已經禁得住人走了。

sentences.english: So desert should take heat with cereus.
sentences.chinese: 水加熱則成爲蒸汽，冷卻則成爲冰。

sentences.english: The snow on the pavement was compacted and has turned to ice.
sentences.chinese: 人行便道上的雪被踩實並結成了冰。

sentences.english: By using ice, Veolia doesn't need to use as much electricity during the day.
sentences.chinese: 通過使用冰，威立雅白天並不需要那麼多的用電量。

sentences.english: Ice caves are very different from normal caves.
sentences.chinese: 冰洞窟與普通的洞窟有着天壤之別。

sentences.english: The ice in the rive melts away and some fishes swimming in it.
sentences.chinese: 小河裏的冰都融化了，很多魚兒在那裏面游來游去。

sentences.english: But his tail had been caught in the ice which had frozen over during the night and as he pulled, it broke off : Whack!
sentences.chinese: 但是它的尾巴已經被牢牢地凍在冰裏了。

sentences.english: After one night over ice compress, I found my leg felt much more better.
sentences.chinese: 經過一個晚上的冰敷，我發現我的腳感覺好多了。

sentences.english: This group is already a congregation of a Russian church during a ritual ice-cold water bathing.
sentences.chinese: 這是在冰水浴儀式中，一座俄羅斯教堂裏的會衆集會。

sentences.english: As she kissed me, her lips felt like ice. 'Come and see me, Ellen;
sentences.chinese: 當她親我時，她的嘴脣像冰似的。

definition: to freeze over/to ice over/icebound/to shelve (a proposal etc)
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
frost/white powder or cream spread over a surface/frosting/(skin) cream
